page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO AREA
page.content:
Set in the foothills of the Cheviots and on the edge of the Northumbrian National Park, our block of land is an area of small clusters of stone houses, green fields and moorlands.
There are many scattered hamlets, mainly farmhouses with three or four farm cottages nearby. The main village of Powburn is the area with the largest population - about 102 people. The only main road, the A697, runs through this village on its way North to Scotland.
It is an area which is rich in wildlife. It is particularly attractive countryside for horseriding and this is a popular pastime. More and more visitors are visiting the area each Summer.
